My Know How

Check out my capabilities...

I started learning HTML when I was 16 years old. I had a personal website for family and friends with domain (www.kixster.be), but it has been retired.

Furthering my knowledge for createing webpages, I started to learn CSS. With this knowledge, I helped friends create pages.

To make more responsive and interactive webpages, I started to learn Javascript. I am still furthering my knowledge with Vue.Js, Node.js and other frameworks.

Data manipulation was my next challenge. So I first turned to PHP, to further grow my knowledge.

Ofcourse, I would need a database to store my data. So I learnt how to work with mySQL, Access and mondoDB.

Page automization was next on my list of challenges. So I turned to Python.

I have worked with Windows since Windows 3 was born. Working my way through almost all the versions. 3, 95, 98, 2000, ME, Vista, 7, 8 and now 10.

There were and still are times where Windows is flawed and I have turned to Linux. Mandrake, Mandriva, Ubuntu, SUSE, Knoppix, Kali, RaspBian and now Mint.

Working with computers has always been a great interest of mine since the days of the XT 286 pc. Hardware doesn't scare me. Take it apart, install it and troubleshooting it is all fun in my books.

Working with servers, webpages and operating systems, a good knowledge of how data moves through the cables and air is a must. For this, I have a good understanding of the inner workings.

Security and protection of data is a must in this day and age. To better secure my networks and to stay ahead of the hackers, I learnt ethical hacking.

I think that the very first programming language that I learnt was Basic. But the language that really started me with programming was C++. This helped me greatly when learning other languages as the principles are basically the same in all languages, just a different syntax and/or mindset.

At the moment all the previously mentioned knowledge is being used as a hobby. The only application that I can use for work purposes is Excel. I find ways to use macros to be more work efficient and to solve problems that our work authorized applications can't. In some cases, I have created full applications in Excel using the VB editor of Excel.
